name: Daniel Couper
bio: I've programmed JS professionally for the last five years: sure, it has it's pain points, and the tooling/package management is somewhat of a hellscape, but on good days I kinda love it.

name: David Fimbres
bio: I think Javascript still has a lot of growing to do and as one of the most widely used languages I want to be able to help others as they grow as well.

name: David Jones
bio: Software engineer and a fan of many programming languages

name: Donovan Mueller
bio: I've been programming in JavaScript for the last 13+ years. I've learned to appreciate its squishiness and flexibility, especially for small projects. It definitely can drive a dev crazy, but with good architecture a lot can be done with it.

name: Raymond Price
bio: Professional developer for the past 7 years, primarily in JS and secondarily in C# and Typescript.
